Package sammish93.tbage.models

Class Player

java.lang.Object
sammish93.tbage.models.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Player extends Object implements Serializable
A class that models a player's player character. This character persists throughout the life of the game, and a player can traverse multiple encounters using the same player character. This class also includes an inventory system that allows a player to trade and loot Item objects, a feat system that allows a developer to change future encounter behaviours based on specific feats earned by the player in previous encounters, as well as hit points and damage values that allow a player to engage in combat.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static Player create() throws InvalidValueException
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Player object with default values. Current and maximum health is set to 10, minimum damage is set to 2, maximum damage is set to 5, currency is set to 100, and inventory slots is set to 10.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown in the event that the player's maximum health is set to a value less than or equal to 0, or the minimum or maximum damage values are set to a negative integer value.

    • create

      public static Player create(int maxHealth, int minDamage, int maxDamage, TreeMap<String,Feat> feats, double currencyAmount, int inventorySlots, TreeMap<String,Item> inventory) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      maxHealth - A positive integer value that determines both the current and maximum health of the player.
      minDamage - A non-negative integer value that determines the minimum damage that a player can inflict upon attacking an Enemy.
      maxDamage - A non-negative integer value that determines the maximum damage that a player can inflict upon attacking an Enemy.
      feats - A collection of instantiated Feat objects that a player has acquired.
      currencyAmount - The amount of currency that a player has.
      inventorySlots - The amount of inventory slots that a player has. A player that attempts to buy or loot an item while having a full (as many items as inventory slots) inventory will result in an InventoryFullException being thrown.
      inventory - A collection of instantiated Item objects that a player has acquired.
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Player object.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown in the event that the player's maximum health is set to a value less than or equal to 0, or the minimum or maximum damage values are set to a negative integer value.
      See Also:
      • InventoryFullException

    • getInventorySlots

      public int getInventorySlots()
      Returns:
      Returns the amount of inventory slots that a player has (including slots that are occupied).

    • setInventorySlots

      public void setInventorySlots(int inventorySlots) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      inventorySlots - A positive integer value determining how many slots a player has.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown in the event that an integer value less than or equal to 0 is provided.

    • getInventory

      public TreeMap<String,Item> getInventory()
      Returns:
      Returns a TreeMap of items in a player's inventory. The key is a string representing the item's name, and the value is the Item object itself.

    • setInventory

      public void setInventory(TreeMap<String,Item> inventory)
      Parameters:
      inventory - Sets the inventory to an already existing TreeMap.

      public Item getItemFromInventory(String itemName)
      Parameters:
      itemName - A string value representing the name of an item.
      Returns:
      Returns an Item object.

    • addItemToInventory

      public void addItemToInventory(Item item) throws InventoryFullException
      This class is used to add an item to an inventory. It is also used in the event that duplicate items exist in the inventory at the same time, in which an index value is added to the suffix of an item's name. (e.g. 'Health Potion' is in a player's inventory. The player loots another 'Health Potion', and the first item is renamed to 'Health Potion 1', while the second is renamed to 'Health Potion 2'. Once one of these items is consumed, the other item wil be renamed back to 'Health Potion' without the suffix.
      Parameters:
      item - An instantiated Item object.
      Throws:
      InventoryFullException - Thrown in the event that an item is added to the inventory when a player doesn't have enough inventory space.

    • addItemToInventory

      public void addItemToInventory(String itemName) throws InventoryFullException
      Parameters:
      itemName - A string value representing the name of an item object.
      Throws:
      InventoryFullException - Thrown in the event that an item is added to the inventory when a player doesn't have enough inventory space.
      See Also:
      • addItemToInventory(Item)

    • removeItemFromInventory

      public void removeItemFromInventory(Item item) throws InventoryFullException
      This class is used to remove an item to an inventory. It is also used in the event that duplicate items exist in the inventory at the same time, in which an index value is added to the suffix of an item's name. (e.g. 'Health Potion' is in a player's inventory. The player loots another 'Health Potion', and the first item is renamed to 'Health Potion 1', while the second is renamed to 'Health Potion 2'. Once one of these items is consumed, the other item wil be renamed back to 'Health Potion' without the suffix.
      Parameters:
      item - An instantiated Item object.
      Throws:
      InventoryFullException - Thrown in the event that an item is added to the inventory when a player doesn't have enough inventory space.

    • removeItemFromInventory

      Parameters:

      Throws:
      InventoryFullException - Thrown in the event that an item is added to the inventory when a player doesn't have enough inventory space.
      See Also:
      • removeItemFromInventory(Item)

    • save

      public void save(String path) throws IOException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is '.ser'.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the .ser file will be saved to, along with the file name. Example: player.save("src/fileName");
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      InvalidPathException - Arises if the path contains characters other than the English alphabet, underscores, and forward slashes.

    • save

      public void save(String path, String fileExtension) throws IOException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is decided by the developer.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the .ser file will be saved to, along with the file name. Example: player.save("src/fileName", "sav");
      fileExtension - The file type extension the developer wishes to save the file as.
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      InvalidPathException - Arises if the path contains characters other than the English alphabet, underscores, and forward slashes.

    • load

      public static Player load(String path) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is only required when the extension is something other than '.ser'.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the file is located at. This can either be with or without the file extension. Examples: var player = Player.load("src/fileNameWithSavExtension.sav"); or var player = Player.load("src/fileNameWithSerExtension");
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      ClassNotFoundException - Arises if the file cannot be deserialised to this class. underscores, and forward slashes.
